sentences.en: " Chang - lin, you're too timid ever to make a go of anything big!
sentences.cn: “ 长林, 你那么胆小,成不得大事!

sentences.en: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
sentences.cn: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

sentences.en: Don't be timid. You can behave without ceremony here.
sentences.cn: 别怕,在这儿你可以不必拘束.

sentences.en: He stopped in the doorway, too timid to go in.
sentences.cn: 他在门口停住了脚步，不好意思进去。

sentences.en: He was not apprehensive or timid through his imagination.
sentences.cn: 他不会由于想像而变得疑虑或者胆怯.

sentences.en: He's rather timid , Tu Chu - chai is rather timid,'said Wang Ho - fu.
sentences.cn: 杜竹翁是胆小了一点儿, 胆小了一点儿.

sentences.en: Her manner was short and abrupt, yet faltering and timid.
sentences.cn: 她的态度有点唐突生硬, 却又犹豫胆怯.

sentences.en: I am not bound to be timid and conventional.
sentences.cn: 我不必有什么顾虑,也不必随波逐流.

sentences.en: Into this important commercial region the timid Carrie went.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉怯生生地走进这个重要的商业区.

sentences.en: Presently a timid knock was heard at the door.
sentences.cn: 不久,听见有人在胆怯地敲门.

sentences.en: Shuchen , the most timid of the girls , stuck close to Mingfeng.
sentences.cn: 淑贞最胆小, 便拉了鸣凤靠着她走.

sentences.en: The little girl is as timid as a hare, shy in the presence of strangers.
sentences.cn: 这小姑娘胆子特别小, 怕人.

sentences.en: The President's critics say he has been too timid in responding to changing international developments.
sentences.cn: 批评总统的人认为他在应对风云变幻的国际局势时过于瞻前顾后。

sentences.en: The rabbit is timid and suspicious.
Timid people always wreak their peevishness on the gentle.
sentences.cn: 怯懦的人总是把满腹牢骚向温和的人发泄.

trans.tran_cn: 胆小的，羞怯的，怕人，羞手羞脚
